import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
adult = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/manipal/adult.csv')
adv = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/manipal/Advertising.csv')
bank = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/manipal/bank-full.csv', sep=";")

fig, axs = plt.subplots(1,3, figsize=(14,5))

axs[0].scatter(adv['radio'], adv['sales'])
axs[1].scatter(adv['TV'], adv['sales'])
axs[2].scatter(adv['newspaper'], adv['sales'])
plt.tight_layout()
source.0879b67b:
col = 'balance'
q1 = bank[col].quantile(0.25)
q2 = bank[col].quantile(0.5)
q3 = bank[col].quantile(0.75)
iqr = q3 - q1
lw = q1 - 1.5 * iqr
uw = q3 + 1.5 * iqr
outliers = bank[(bank[col]<lw) | (bank[col] > uw)][col]
perc_outliers = outliers.shape[0] / bank.shape[0] * 100
print('Percentage of outliers in %s column is: %.2f %%' % (col, perc_outliers))
bank[col].plot.box();
